p: We modeled ragweed distribution using climate predictor variables only. Alternative modeling approaches could also include other factors, such as dispersal, land-use change, CO 2 concentrations, and geographic and ecotypic variation among ragweed populations. Others have also developed mechanistic modeling approaches to predict ragweed distribution [ 20, 38] and cite that climate envelope modeling may underestimate the true potential range of invasive species [ 21, 40]. We agree. Integrating mechanistic and empirical modeling approaches may improve the predictive power and certainty associated with future projections [ 41]. Predictive models could also be parameterized and restrained with known dispersal abilities, as has been done with common ragweed in Europe [ 42].
